newsitem.title: USA: MFS not hurt by stay of FCC telecom rules.
newsitem.headline: MFS not hurt by stay of FCC telecom rules.

text.p: MFS Communications Co Inc said its interconnection arrangements with local exchange carriers were not hurt by a September 27 temporary stay order of the Federal Communications Commission's local telecommunications rules.

"Under the 1996 Telecom Act, competitors, such as MFS, can enter into interconnection agreements with incumbent carriers separate and distinct from the procedures set forth in the FCC rules," said MFS Chairman James Crowe in a statement.
"MFS now has such agreements with six of the seven regional bell operating companies, as well as major independents," he added.

He continued, "The bilaterally negotiated agreements now in place encompass nearly 90 percent of MFS' U.S. markets. As a result of these binding agreements, we anticipate little adverse impact from the (US. Court of Appeals) action."
MFS markets communication services for businesses.
